image.altText: Woman in beanie and coat sits on park bench

props.synopsis: Amelia Bird would love to become a home-owner in Tasmania, but she isn't hopeful. Like many others, she is looking at what is being promised at this month's state election for people who want a place of their own.

title.children: These Tasmanians want to see housing as the number one priority this election

image.altText: Golden coins featuring the logos of popular cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, DOGE and Ethereum

props.synopsis: Scammers have used promises of lucrative investments, romantic relationships, and pleas for assistance to steal $2.5 million from 15 Tasmanians. Police say the victims will suffer life long impacts.

title.children: 15 people lose combined $2.5 million to crypto ATM scams

image.altText: Model of a proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: Amid a state election campaign, Tasmania's Planning Commission has continued assessing the proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium. Here's what it heard during the past fortnight's hearings.

title.children: What we learnt from the Macquarie Point stadium hearings

props.synopsis: This view inside some of the most precious and rare museum specimens on Earth is helping scientists to better understand the story of life — and it's all done without a scalpel in sight.

title.children: The CT scans that wiped millions off the value of a museum's collection

image.altText: Smoke from wood fuelled heater

props.synopsis: As tourists are urged to come to Tasmania "for air", pollution in Launceston is forcing some locals to leave. Experts say if wood heaters are used properly, it could help improve air quality.

title.children: 'Unliveable': Local leaves Tasmanian city amid widespread wood heater use

image.altText: Black text hides information in a document

props.synopsis: It took a right to information 'mistake' for the ABC to become aware of concerns about youth in adult prison watch houses. But so much more information remains buried under black ink. Does it have to be this way?

title.children: Accidental release of information a 'good thing', premier says. Should it be the norm?

props.synopsis: ABC Stateline's Guy Stayner speaks with Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter.

title.children: STATELINE: Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter talks about his party's plan ahead of the July 19 election

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing, to the stadium.

title.children: What are Tasmanians being promised at their state election?

image.altText: first sat pic

props.synopsis: Satellite images show Iran's attack on a US military base in Qatar in June hit a dome housing equipment used for secure communications.

title.children: Pentagon confirms Iran's attack on Qatar air base hit dome used for US communications

image.altText: A shirtless man with tattooes.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most wanted men amassed grand wealth while luring his mates into a police trap. The problem is he may never face justice down under.

title.children: One of Australia's most wanted had everything. Now he faces 262 years' jail

image.altText: Donald Trump, raising his fist, and his wife Melania walk in front of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Visiting the area of Texas hit by deadly flooding last week, US President Donald Trump defends government officials who have faced scrutiny over whether they could have done more to warn residents ahead of the disaster.

title.children: Trump defends state and federal response to deadly Texas floods

image.altText: An aerial photo showing a Navy ship in the open ocean, with a military jet flying overhead.

props.synopsis: As Prime Minister Anthony Albanese heads north to China for a week-long visit, Australia's defence force says it is watching for Chinese spy vessels off the Queensland and NT coastlines.

title.children: ADF watching for Chinese spy ships as PM heads to Shanghai

image.altText: A mural reading "FOREVER 20" for the late Diogo Jota.

props.synopsis: No Liverpool player at any level of the club will wear number 20 as a mark of respect to Diogo Jota, who died in a car crash last week.

title.children: Liverpool retires number 20 jersey in honour of late Diogo Jota

image.altText: Western Bulldogs forward Aaron Naughton rises and gets two hands around the ball as the Crows try to spoil him.

props.synopsis: It's a shootout at Docklands to start a crucial day of footy for the make up of the top eight. Aaron Naughton has five for the Bulldogs, but Riley Thilthorpe has matched him to put the Crows in a strong position. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Naughton on fire for Bulldogs but Crows lead in a shootout

image.altText: Red rocks depicting rock art

props.synopsis: The UNESCO has approved World Heritage status for the 50,000-year-old rock art of Murujuga, in Western Australia in Paris.

title.children: UNESCO approves World Heritage bid for rock art amid emissions concerns

image.altText: A group of rugby league players celebrate a try

props.synopsis: Two tries to Dominic Young, including a solo stunner, has given Newcastle a shock lead over Melbourne. Follow live.

title.children: Returning Knight's double gives Newcastle surprise lead over Storm

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HT: Newcastle Knights 8 leading Melbourne Storm 6
39' TRY: Melbourne score just before half-time
28' TRY: Dom Young has a double

image.altText: JoJo Siwa wears a suit as she waves to someone.

props.synopsis: US singers Jojo Siwa and Cari Fletcher have caused a stir in the queer community. Here's why.

title.children: Why Fletcher and JoJo Siwa are causing controversy in the queer community

image.altText: A birds eye view of the ocean waves coming to the top of a break wall which has grass and a footpath on top.

props.synopsis: Lancelin Shire president Linda Balcombe says support is needed to rebuild the town's dunes ahead of likely king tides expected in August.

title.children: Fears king tides could engulf tiny coastal town within months

image.altText: Iga Swiatek and Amanda Anisimova at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Iga Świątek is trying to become the first woman since Ash Barty to win majors on all three surfaces, while Amanda Anisimova can keep alive US hopes of an "American Slam" with a maiden Wimbledon title.

title.children: Świątek trying to match Barty in Wimbledon final against comeback queen

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera while surrounded by long grass.

props.synopsis: After a tragic loss, this rural town took the mental health of its shearing community into its own hands, and hopes to spread the message to every shed across the country.

title.children: When Mitch died at 22, his town started a shearing event to save others

image.altText: The original Birkin bag on top of black glass display case.

props.synopsis: Why just having enough money will not buy you one of the most exclusive accessories in the fashion world.

title.children: How luxury handbag collectors 'play the Hermès game' to secure Birkins

image.altText: A small native mouse sits on a branch

props.synopsis: Decades after it was last seen in the region, the threatened pookila has reappeared in the Goobang National Park, boosting hopes for the species' survival.

title.children: Rare 'engineer' mouse spotted in Western NSW after almost 30 years

image.altText: A badly damaged car has come to a halt after crashing into a park bench. There is police tape in the foreground

props.synopsis: A deadly crash involving a 91-year-old driver has prompted discussion about whether Victoria's rules for elderly drivers need changing in line with other parts of Australia.

title.children: Researchers defend Victoria's elderly driver rules after fatal crash

image.altText: A woman stands for a photo in front of a koala exhibit at the zoo with children whose faces are blurred

props.synopsis: It remains unclear how many Australians and their families remain stuck in Iran, more than two weeks after a US-brokered ceasefire with Israel was implemented.

title.children: Australian grandmother who fled Iran overland says DFAT 'not helpful'

image.altText: Two men in wetsuits stand together near water

props.synopsis: The Mexican prosecutor leading the case against the suspected murderers of Jake and Callum Robinson says there's still no evidence of cartel involvement.

title.children: Mexican prosecutor prepares case against accused killers of Aussie surfers

image.altText: Dead fish laying on the seabed surrounded by green waters

props.synopsis: New footage captured near a South Australian jetty shows scores of fish lying dead in "dark neon green" waters as fishers say the toxic algal bloom is affecting the industry. Warning: Readers are advised this article includes content some may find confronting.

title.children: 'Dead fish everywhere': Video shows underwater impact of SA's algal bloom

image.altText: Gout Gout takes a selfie with fans at the Monaco Diamond League.

props.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Gout Gout wins the under-23 200m race at the Diamond League event in Monaco, where Jess Hull and Peter Bol beat national records.

title.children: Fans erupt for Gout Gout's under-23 win at Diamond League in Monaco

image.altText: A red, black and white bulk carrier half-submerged in dark blue ocean water

props.synopsis: The death toll from the attack that sank the Liberian-flagged Eternity C ship is the highest from any seaborne assault carried out by the Iranian-backed rebels in the crucial maritime trade route.

title.children: At least four dead and 11 missing after Houthi attack on Red Sea cargo ship

image.altText: Two men look at the debris of a monastery, with rubble strewn on the ground next to the structure.

props.synopsis: An air strike on a Buddhist monastery in Myanmar's central Sagaing region has killed 23 people taking shelter in the compound, according to witnesses.

title.children: Air strike on Buddhist monastery in Myanmar kills more than 20 people

image.altText: GHF image Rafah

props.synopsis: The United Nations says most of those killed had been close to aid sites managed by the US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation.

title.children: UN says almost 800 people killed near Gaza aid hubs in six weeks

image.altText: Mitch Starc raises his arms

props.synopsis: For years, Mitchell Starc's suitability to Test cricket was a matter of debate. But now, on the cusp of becoming just the second fast bowler to earn 100 caps for Australia, his greatness in the format is undeniable.

title.children: On the eve of his 100th Test, Mitchell Starc has fought his way to immortality

image.altText: Two young boys in beenies pose with platic toy guns.

props.synopsis: Record numbers of drones and missiles are increasingly being launched at Ukrainian cities, in what analysts say appears to be a new Russian tactic.

title.children: More than 700 drones and counting as Russia ramps up new war tactics

image.altText: patient lies on bed as doctor checks his skin using new medical device

props.synopsis: A Queensland doctor adopts emerging technology to spare more patients from the scalpel as a fear of needles and the risk of "unnecessary" scarring can deter people from getting skin cancer checks.

title.children: Cairns skin clinic imports machine to spare patients from scars

image.altText: A plate of pumpkin, lentil and coconut curry, topped with coconut cream and tadka. Slow cooker visible with more curry.

props.synopsis: Hearty lentils, creamy coconut, and the sweetness of pumpkin elevate this curry to a league of its own.

title.children: Come home to this slow-cooker curry with pumpkin, lentils and coconut
